Key Match Events: The Brooklyn Nets narrowly beat the Memphis Grizzlies, 106-104.
Dennis Schroder came up with a clutch layup to cap off the Nets' night at 106 points.
Cameron Johnson was blocked with seconds to go, giving the Grizzlies an opportunity to win.
Post-Match Reflections: The biggest positive for the Nets was the balanced scoring, showcasing the chemistry and coaching of the team.
Dennis Schroder has shined as the team's floor general, averaging 19.9 points and 7.2 assists so far.
Brooklyn's veterans have emerged as some of the best role players in the NBA.
